meta.title: What did I learn this week (2021) - 35
meta.description: Weekly summarization and review of things I've learned in the final week of August 2021

pageProps.content:
• How I Experience Web Today is a satirical site that expresses the concerns a commoner have when accessing popular websites today.
  • Found a Tech Interview Handbook. It leads me to another curated list of helpful leetcode problems.
  • Found a good system design blog from discord.
  • More Than 80 Cultures Still Speak in Whistles.
  • How does Google Authenticator work?
  • Futureme.org helps us to write a letter to our future self.
  • Read Julia Evans's "Pattern in confusing explanations".
  • Otto, Prince of Bismarck, Count of Bismarck-Sch√∂nhausen, Duke of Lauenburg, born Junker Otto Eduard Leopold von Bismarck, was a conservative German statesman, diplomat, and writer. Bismarck masterminded the unification of Germany in 1871 and served as its first chancellor until 1890, in which capacity he dominated European affairs for two decades.
  • Carl Philipp Gottfried von Clausewitz was a Prussian general and military theorist who stressed the "moral" and political aspects of war.
